item.title: Learning german
item.description:
It is after meeting a very nice German guy from the school I work at (and becoming friends with him) who was there for four weeks observing classes and teaching a few lessons for his university programme, that I got more comfortable with the idea that I could learn German again. Even though I was bad at it in middle-school. It is important for me to challenge my sterile own beliefs, especially regarding my so-called inabilities.

As it is for mathematics, which I’ve always thought I would eternally be bad at, from primary school onwards, I picked up programming (Python and later Go). I wouldn’t dive into Foundational mathematics as I see no direct interest in it, but programming is the closest hobby that uses maths, and, for me, which is a victory over my past F student self.

Of course I’ve got a goal set through learning German. The craziest is reading German Philosophy in its source language, but there is also a beauty, a complexity and craft in the language that I appreciate. Being able to connect to a culture through their language is for me a way to expand our humanity.

I believe settling for bilingualism only is not enough, and I need to pick up a third language. That is why I signed up for Ouino. I’m now trying to find a German person to converse with, like a ’tutor'.
